Hello, 


I wanted to ask sth regarding the view of the sky for different sky models like Perez, intermediate with sky ... to visually see the distribution of the luminance and the position of the sun. I created the sky.rad file as follows for intermediate sky with sun (in Vienna)


!gensky 9 5 14:00 +i -a 48.14 -o 16.2 -m -15 -R 106.5204882 -B 429.0795118


skyfunc glow skyglow 
0
0
4                1                1                  1                  0


skyglow source sky
0
0
4                0                  0                  1             180


and after using


oconv sky.rad > sky.oct 


I used the rview command as descibed in the book:


rview -vta -vp 0 0 0 -vd 0 0 1 -vu 0 1 0 -vh 180 -vv 180 sky.oct 


But all I can get is an angular fish eye-view of the sky only white, without any  distribution. 


I would appreciate if someone could help me to fix this problem. 


Thank you very much


Regards, Sokol
